A police officer
A Justice of the Peace
A lawyer

Question: If you have to drive at a slow speed which may hold up other vehicles, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep as close as you can to the centre of the road
Keep as close as you can to the left side of the road
Make the traffic behind you slow down to the speed that you are driving at

Vehicles that use the lane must have two passengers
Only two vehicles are permitted on the transit lane at any time

Only use the vehicle during daylight hours

Question: What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Walk to get help
Wave down a passing vehicle
Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Question: This sign tells you that you are coming up to a railway level crossing. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Slow down so that you can look both ways to check that the crossing is clear
Speed up to drive over the crossing as quickly as possible
Stop to check whether the crossing is clear
Turn your vehicle indicators on before driving over the crossing

Question: Who is responsible for making a child under 14 years use a seat belt or a safety seat in a vehicle?

Answers.Answer: The child’s parents
The driver of the vehicle
The owner of the vehicle
The child

Question: You must NOT park on the right-hand side of the road, except when:

Answers.Answer: in the countryside
picking up passengers
delivering packages
in a one-way street

Yes

Look to the right-hand side of the road
Look to the centre of the road
Turn the headlights of your vehicle onto high beam

The centre of the road
No passing
The far right side of the road

Do not drive faster than 100km/h

Question: What should you do when another vehicle is following you very closely?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get further ahead
Brake suddenly to warn them
Flick your vehicle lights and wave your arm
Slow down, move to the left and allow the vehicle to pass

Question: When parking downhill on a steep road, what does the road code suggest that you should do?

Answers.Answer: Leave your keys in the vehicle in case the brakes fail
Turn the front wheels of your vehicle away from the kerb and leave the vehicle in first gear
Turn the front wheels of your vehicle towards the kerb and leave the vehicle in reverse gear
Leave the wheels of your vehicle straight ahead and make sure that the handbrake is on

Question: What should you do when you are coming up to traffic signals and the signals change from green to yellow?

Answers.Answer: Stop at the signals if you can do so safely
Speed up before the light changes to red
Stop even if it means stopping in the middle of the intersection
Turn hard to the left and stop around the corner

2 metres
3 metres
4 metres

Question: You may park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if you:

Answers.Answer: leave your keys in your vehicle
have someone stay with the vehicle who can move it
leave a note on the vehicle saying ‘Back soon’

Question: If you are under 20, which statement is correct?

Answers.Answer: You are not permitted to drink any alcohol before driving
You may drink two standard glasses of alcohol
You may drink one standard glass of alcohol
There are no restrictions on limits of alcohol but you are not able to drive if intoxicated
